problems.problem_statement: Calculate the flux of the vector field F = 2x*i - 3y*j across the unit circle centered at the origin
Find the outward flux of F = 2x*i + (x - y)*j through the boundary of the unit circle
Compute the flux of F = x*i + y*j across the closed path consisting of the upper semicircle of radius 1 and the line segment along the x-axis from (-1,0) to (1,0)
problems.curve: Semicircle r1(t) = [a*cos(t), a*sin(t)], 0 ≤ t ≤ π, followed by line r2(t) = [t, 0], -a ≤ t ≤ a

problems.problem_statement: Determine the flux of F = x²*i + y²*j through the boundary formed by the upper semicircle of radius 1 and the diameter along the x-axis
problems.curve: Semicircle r1(t) = [a*cos(t), a*sin(t)], 0 ≤ t ≤ π, followed by line r2(t) = [t, 0], -a ≤ t ≤ a

problems.problem_statement: Calculate the flux of F = -y*i + x*j across the closed path consisting of the upper semicircle of radius a and the line segment from (-a,0) to (a,0)
problems.curve: Semicircle r1(t) = [a*cos(t), a*sin(t)], 0 ≤ t ≤ π, followed by line r2(t) = [t, 0], -a ≤ t ≤ a

problems.problem_statement: Find the flux of F = -y²*i + x²*j through the boundary formed by the upper semicircle of radius a and its diameter
problems.curve: Semicircle r1(t) = [a*cos(t), a*sin(t)], 0 ≤ t ≤ π, followed by line r2(t) = [t, 0], -a ≤ t ≤ a

problems.problem_statement: Compute the outward flux of F = (x - y)*i + x*j across the unit circle centered at the origin
Determine the flux of F = (x + y)*i - (x² + y²)*j across the triangular path with vertices at (1,0), (0,1), and (-1,0)
Calculate the flux of F = y*i - x*j across the circle of radius 2 centered at the origin
Find the flux of F = eˣ*i + ln(y+1)*j across the closed path consisting of the upper semicircle of radius 3 and the line segment from (-3,0) to (3,0)
problems.curve: Semicircle r1(t) = [3*cos(t), 3*sin(t)], 0 ≤ t ≤ π, followed by line r2(t) = [t, 0], -3 ≤ t ≤ 3
